instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 no internal display
threads.message: [SIZE=12px]i have a 820-3332 that came in for no power, after diag realized its powering on fully just no internal display, checked smc_lid and realized it was 0, repaired and got screen for about 30 seconds, then black. figured out after a few seconds i lost [/SIZE]PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD_ISNS, so i jumped it from pin 2 to pin 5 of u9000 and no more loss of display after a few seconds, leading me to believe u9000 is bad, question is do i have to replace it, what harm will just jumping it do. i dont have a donor board for this board so if i have to replace it for some reason where can i get this chip?

threads.title: 820-3332 no internal display
threads.message: Did you already touch up the soldering on U8900?

threads.title: 820-3332 no internal display
threads.message: no i touched up all the solder joints on u9000, i just touched up u8900 even tho it looked fine and its lasting longer than 20 seconds this time, "jumper removed ofc" so i guess i had a bad solder joint, but i wounder would my jumper have caused any issues?

threads.title: 820-3332 no internal display
threads.message: No U8900’s joints cracking is the signature fault of the 3332 board. Typically that fixes the video issues on it. Likely no issue with jumper or U9000 at all.

threads.title: 820-3332 no internal display
threads.message: Give U8900 a proper reflow. Touching up the contacts will only last a few weeks/months.
